checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: Required in O1-CompoSE for training 3D object generation models and developing text-to-3D synthesis capabilities.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes:
800K+ images of 3D objects. Categories include:
Total unique categories: 18
architecture: 76,802
characters-creatures: 59,299
cultural-heritage-history: 55,614
furniture-home: 51,888
art-abstract: 50,310
science-technology: 46,860
weapons-military: 35,189
electronics-gadgets: 28,860
nature-plants: 28,319
animals-pets: 27,479
cars-vehicles: 26,765
places-travel: 18,487
people: 13,199
food-drink: 12,047
fashion-style: 9,595
sports-fitness: 4,200
music: 2,845
news-politics: 951

"weapons-military" was inspected and had pictures of avatars of modern and historic e.g. knives, swords, pistols and guns.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
Required for training generalizable robotic manipulation policies, imitation learning research, and Vision-Language-Action (VLA) model development across multiple robot embodiments.
Total size : 815 + 514 + 45 + 1678 ≈ 3052 episodes

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: Movies of robots manipulation tasks common objects e.g. household, industrial etc.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes:
Affiliated organization:
The Beijing Humanoid Robot Innovation Center was established in November 2023 in Beijing Economic and Technological Development Zone (Beijing Yizhuang). It is the first innovation center in China that focuses on the core technology, product development, and application ecosystem construction of humanoid robots.
https://huggingface.co/X-Humanoid
https://x-humanoid-robomind.github.io/

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
To used in reinforcement learning part of the RL model (O4). Aligns with Datascience and Engineering. 
69 datasets in total. Applicant did not identify which ones they required for their research.
67 out of 69 datasets contain real RGB image observations.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes:
According to the paper describing the dataset, it contains a range of household objects, from appliances to food items and utensils. https://arxiv.org/html/2310.08864v4 
The dataset contains over 1 million real robot trajectories from 22+ robot embodiments, spanning manipulation tasks like pick-and-place, drawer opening, object rearrangement, and more. The data comes from different labs worldwide, each with their own robot setups.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes:
All authors of the paper had affiliations in 2023 with organizations from non-D5 countries. 
https://arxiv.org/html/2310.08864v4

checks.name: Prompts / Fine-tuning Scripts
checks.notes: No user files provided.

checks.name: Sample Inspection
checks.notes:
Sample artifacts were inspected in this notebook: https://github.com/mshaikh786/aimcr-scripts/blob/Elhoseiny-DS/65638-Elhoseiny/Dataset-inspection/x-embodiment/x-embodiment.pdf
It included RBG camera images of images manipulating objects in a lab environment.

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes:
Licenses stated in the official repository
Software code: Apache License 2.0
Data / other materials: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 (CC-BY 4.0)
Permissibility:
Academic & research use:  Allowed
Commercial use:  Allowed (with conditions)
Modification: Allowed
Redistribution:  Allowed
Obligations
Apache-2.0: Preserve license and copyright notices
CC-BY-4.0: Attribution required when redistributing or publishing derived work
Important nuance
Open X-Embodiment is an aggregate benchmark. Developers must check individual licenses associated with each component datasets

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: LIBERO has been requested as a dataset by the applicant, primarily aligned with Objective O3 (ContextFlow) the in-context robot foundation model. It aligns with the approved topic Datascience and Engineering.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: Approximately made up of a collection of 6500 multimodal recording. Inspection of images at different timestamp reveals simulated robots working on different object in a lab environment.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes: The dataset is maintained by the Lifelong Robot Learning group, with contributions affiliated with Google DeepMind.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: Algined with training  Scalable Long Video-Language Understanding (objective 2). Algins with research topic datascience and engineering.

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes:
No mention of prohibited use terms in the documentation. Inspection reveals simulated images of objects, statistical graphs and piecharts, geometrical problems and solutions, cartoon images depicting stories and captions, xray, sonograms, and MRI images, etc. 

Dataset in English and Chinese.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes:
Dataset owned and maintained by LMMs-Lab. It is a non-profit research-oriented organization with a group of passionate researchers, we share the sincere passion for developing multimodal intelligence.

LLaVA-OneVision:
Bo Li, Yuanhan Zhang, Dong Guo, Renrui Zhang, Feng Li, Hao Zhang, Kaichen Zhang, Peiyuan Zhang, Yanwei Li, Ziwei Liu, Chunyuan Li.
